means: 使…震惊( shock的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: It is shocking that humans can behave with such bestiality towards others.
sentence.Network_cn: 令人震惊的是，人竟然能对同类下此毒手。

sentence.Network_en: I must have been in a shocking state last night.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨晚我的情况一定很糟糕。

sentence.Network_en: It's shocking how students can't spell these days.
sentence.Network_cn: 当今的学生们拼写上差得令人吃惊。

entry.def: You can say that something is shocking if you think that it is very bad.

example.tran: 当时媒体的报道糟透了。

example.ex: I must have been in a shocking state last night.
example.tran: 昨晚我的情况一定很糟糕。

entry.tran: 令人震惊的;令人愤慨的;不道德的
entry.def: You can say that something is shocking if you think that it is morally wrong.

example.ex: It is shocking that nothing was said...
example.tran: 当时竟然什么都没说,真让人愤慨。

example.ex: This was a shocking invasion of privacy.
example.tran: 这是对隐私的公然侵犯。

means.word_mean: 1. glaringly vivid and graphic; marked by sensationalism;
2. giving offense to moral sensibilities and injurious to reputation;

sentences.sentence: "the wicked rascally shameful conduct of the bankrupt"- Thackeray
"the most shocking book of its time"

auth_sentence.content: He was still in shocking pain and entirely feeble.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was still in shocking pain and entirely feeble.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was still in shocking pain and entirely feeble.

auth_sentence.content: There were undoubtedly shocking and disturbing images from yesterday.
auth_sentence.res_content: There were undoubtedly shocking and disturbing images from yesterday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There were undoubtedly shocking and disturbing images from yesterday.

Sentence.sentence: It turns out that the guy operates the printing machine with amazing speed, and soon he's turning out newspapers with shocking headlines.

A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.

means.word_mean: 骇人的,令人震惊的;使人心烦意乱;极不恰当的

sentences.en: a deeply shocking and painful discovery
sentences.cn: 令人深感震惊并极为痛苦的发现

sentences.en: His attitude was shocking to her.
sentences.cn: 他的态度令她感到震惊。

sentences.en: It’s shocking how he has gone to seed in last few years.
sentences.cn: 近年来他衰颓的程度令人吃惊。

sentences.en: The shocking revelations caused quite a storm.
sentences.cn: 这些惊人的揭露引起了一阵相当激烈的反应。

sentences.en: The toilets and other communal facilities were in a shocking state.
sentences.cn: 厕所及其他公共设施的状况极其糟糕。

sentences.en: We felt curious (as to) how she received the shocking news.
sentences.cn: 我们很想知道她听到这坏消息时的反应。

sentences.en: The report lays bare the shocking housing conditions in this city.
sentences.cn: 那份报告揭露了这座城巿恶劣的住房条件。
